oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-01-30 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from January 30, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer) with his Smoky Mountain Boys (including Howdy Forrester, June Webb, Bashful Brother Oswald, and Jimmy Riddle), guest performer Billy Walker, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, and June Carter. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1060th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Archie Campbell; Billy Walker; Tommy Jackson; Howdy Forrester; June Webb; Jimmy Riddle
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Roll On Buddy, Roll On (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Grant Turner introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell, Roy Acuff) -- Grant Turner and Roy Acuff introduce Billy Walker -- Forever (Billy Walker) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces Tommy Jackson and Howdy Forrester -- Snowflake Reel (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Howdy Forrester fiddle) -- Grant Turner introduces June Webb -- What A Price To Pay (June Webb) -- Grant Turner introduces Jimmy Riddle -- Indian Love Call (Jimmy Riddle harmonica)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Jackson, Tommy; Campbell, Archie; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Bashful Brother Oswald; Webb, June, 1934-; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Walker, Billy, 1929-2006; Gibson, Don (Donald Eugene), 1928-2003
